content.raw: A minimal set of overlapping functions has the downside of increasing the end user's code complexity. They will either maintain two separate and different sets of code (one for gazebo and one for mujoco), or sprinkle lots of `#ifdefs` in their code. Alternatively, mujoco and gazebo can implement a complete set of functions and return appropriate errors when functions are not implemented. Stepping into the shoes of a someone who has to use this interface, I would prefer the complete set of functions.
